ranked_results.description: Global disease outbreak surveillance data containing geographic markers, alert IDs, and HTML-formatted outbreak information for various diseases including influenza, dengue, COVID-19, avian flu, measles, and other infectious diseases across multiple countries and regions. Data includes location coordinates, timestamps, news sources, and outbreak details.

outbreak_indicators: Significant increase in dengue cases and deaths in Bangladesh
First flu-related death of the season in Snohomish County, Washington
key_patterns: Rapid increase in dengue cases and deaths in Bangladesh over a short period
Seasonal influenza activity beginning in Snohomish County, Washington
urgent_concerns: High number of dengue-related deaths in Bangladesh indicating a severe outbreak
analysis.summary: The data indicates a severe dengue outbreak in Bangladesh with a rapid increase in cases and deaths, suggesting a significant public health concern. Additionally, the first flu-related death of the season in Snohomish County, Washington, marks the beginning of seasonal influenza activity.
recommendations: Immediate public health intervention in Bangladesh to control the dengue outbreak, including vector control measures and public awareness campaigns.
Enhanced surveillance and vaccination campaigns in Snohomish County to mitigate the impact of the influenza season.

initial_context_used:
Considerations for Defining an Outbreak
An outbreak is typically defined when the number of cases exceeds what is normally expected for a given population, area, and time period. Here are the key considerations:
1. Epidemiological Thresholds
Statistical Definitions:
2-3 Standard Deviations: Cases exceeding 2-3 standard deviations above the baseline/expected number
Endemic Threshold: When disease incidence surpasses the usual endemic level
Epidemic Curve: Sudden increase in the slope of new cases...
